intro: Sigesbeckia orientalis f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sigesbeckia, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, hairy, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters, resembling daisies, and bloom from summer to autumn. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
